intro: Megastylis gigas, commonly known as the giant stylis, is a striking member of the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 15 centimeters in diameter. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its inflorescence consists of multiple flowers arranged in a spike, with a distinctive, elongated spur. The botanical features of Megastylis gigas make it a unique and sought-after species in horticulture.
